title: Prompt versioning - keep history of regenerations instead of duplicates
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

When regenerating a prompt:

1. Don't create a new history entry - update the existing one
2. Keep a version history within each prompt item (v0, v1, v2, v3...)
3. Each version stores:
   - The generated output
   - Timestamp of generation
4. UI should show:
   - Version selector (v0, v1, v2...)
   - Date of each generation
   - Ability to view and copy any version

This prevents duplicate prompts cluttering history while preserving all generations.

title: Android Prompter App (Nothing OS 4.0 style)
description: Create Android version of Prompter app using Jetpack Compose. Visual style: Nothing OS 4.0 native (monochromatic, dot-matrix aesthetic, high contrast black/white/red). Build: Gradle wrapper from shell (no Android Studio). Use OpenAI ChatGPT API for prompt generation (not Claude Code CLI). Include install script for Java/Android SDK prerequisites.

title: Make generate button state per-prompt, not global
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

The generate buttons (short/long) state should be independent per prompt, not global.

Current issue: Generation state is shared globally, so switching between prompts shows incorrect state.

Fix needed:
1. Each prompt history item should track its own generation state (isGeneratingShort, isGeneratingLong)
2. When selecting a different prompt, the UI should reflect that prompt's generation state
3. Multiple prompts can be generating simultaneously with correct state display

This ties into the existing per-request result storage and parallel generation support.

title: Store generation status and show in sidebar with resume capability
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

1. Store generation status (in progress, completed, failed) with each history item
2. Show generation status indicator in the sidebar next to each prompt
3. If user clicks away while generation is in progress, they should be able to click back on that item in the sidebar and see the ongoing progress
4. Resume viewing generation results even after navigating away

title: Store result per request, not globally
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Currently the generated result is stored globally. Each prompt request should store its own result in the history item.

Changes needed:
- PromptHistory should store the generated output
- Each history item shows its own result when selected
- New generation doesn't overwrite previous results

title: Implement history and templates
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Create history sidebar (drawer on mobile), template picker chips, version selector for regenerations. Use Room database for persistence. Match macOS app behavior.

title: Allow parallel prompt generation calls
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Allow multiple prompt generation requests to run in parallel.

Requirements:
- User can submit new prompts while previous ones are generating
- Each request is independent
- Show progress/status for each active request
- Results are stored per-request in history

title: Split generate into short/long prompt options with separate system prompts
description:

2. 'Generate Long Prompt' - detailed, comprehensive output

  - 'Long Prompt System' - for generating detailed prompts
- Each should have its own default and reset button

UI: Two generate buttons, clearly labeled, perhaps side by side or in a segmented control.

title: Connect prompt submission to Claude Code CLI
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

When user enters a prompt and submits, it only stores to history but doesn't actually call Claude Code CLI to generate variants.

Fix: Wire up submitPrompt() in MainView to call PromptService.generateVariants() and display the results in the UI.
